name: Panch Phoran Shalgam(Turnip with indian 5 spice mix). Vegan glutenfree.
description: The spice mix used for this turnip preparation is called Panch Phoran. is a spice blend used in Bangladesh and Eastern India, especially in Mithila, Bengali, Assamese and Oriya cuisine. The name literally means "five spices".
recipeIngredient: Mix equal quantities of Fennel, Fenugreek, brown mustard, Nigella and Cumin seeds.
chili flakes or black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pan, add oil and heat at medium.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium pan, add oil and heat at medium.

recipeInstructions.text: When the oil is hot, add 1-2 teaspoons of coarsely ground Paanch phoran. Start with 1 teaspoon, you can add more later to taste. The spices have quite a strong individual taste.
recipeInstructions.name: When the oil is hot, add 1-2 teaspoons of coarsely ground Paanch phoran. Start with 1 teaspoon, you can add more later to taste. The spices have quite a strong individual taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix for a half a minute till the spices start to give out an aroma.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix for a half a minute till the spices start to give out an aroma.

recipeInstructions.text: Add Turnip, salt and chili flakes or black pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Turnip, salt and chili flakes or black pepper to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix well, cook covered on low heat for 10-12 minute, or until tender(depends on the size of the cubes) Stir occasionally in between. Also, taste test when just about done and adjust salt and spice mix.
